glsa.title: e2fsprogs: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A heap-based buffer overflow in e2fsprogs could result in execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: e2fsprogs is a set of utilities for maintaining the ext2, ext3 and ext4 file systems.

description.p: e2fsprogs has a heap-based buffer overflow in closefs.c in the libext2fs library.

impact.p: A local attacker could execute arbitrary code via a specially crafted block group descriptor.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All e2fsprogs users should upgrade to the latest version:
